explanation: The report is correct. MHD_lookup_connection_value simply forwards pos->value (and MHD_lookup_connection_value_n can return pos->value_size) but the wrapper MHD_lookup_connection_value exposes only a const char * with no guarantee that the buffer is NUL-terminated. Callers (get_session, can_compress, ahc_cb, etc.) then call string.h functions such as strcmp, strstr and strlen on that pointer. If header values are stored as length+buffer (value_size bytes) without a terminating '\0', those string functions will read past the end of the object and can access out-of-bounds memory, which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. Absent an invariant elsewhere in the code that always NUL-terminates pos->value, the reported violation is valid.
